definition: down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works

sentences.english: From time to time, Putin likes to use a dirty word or utter an obscene threat.
sentences.chinese: 時不時地，普京喜歡用髒字或者突然說出下作的恐嚇。

sentences.english: Notable application of power electronics is HVI)C power transmission over long distance.
sentences.chinese: 電力在高壓下作長距離輸送，能耗比低壓時小。

sentences.english: We do not know anything about the conditions under which the decision will have to be made.
sentences.chinese: 我們對將來會在什麼樣的條件下作決定一無所知。

sentences.english: He made strong resolutions to serve as a worthy king under the kingship of God.
sentences.chinese: 他堅決表示，並在上帝的統治下作一位良善的君王。

sentences.english: The authorities say the latest, more brazen attacks represent new tactics on the part of the Naxalites.
sentences.chinese: 當局說，最近更下作的襲擊表明納薩爾派的新策略。

sentences.english: This year, a new butterfly hotspot, Yuan Tun Ha (Tai Po) is introduced.
sentences.chinese: 今年我們更新增大埔元墩下作普查地點。

sentences.english: "Oh, cheap, very cheap, " said the angel.
sentences.chinese: “哦，惡毒，你太下作了吧”天使說。

definition: variant of 下三濫|下三滥[xia4 san1 lan4]
lower course of a river/low-class/mean and lowly/vulgar/obscene
sordid and contemptible (idiom); vile and repulsive (esp. character or action)
to have no sense of shame/brazen
to have no sense of shame/shameless
to be lacking in moral sense/to lack common basic respect for others/lacking in virtue/mischievous/wicked/cruel/mean
